{{Infobox figure skater |name= Mark Militano |image= |caption= |fullname= Mark William Militano |altname= |country= [[United States]] |formercountry= |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1954|3|28}} |birth_place= [[Rockville Centre, New York]] |hometown= |residence= |death_date= |death_place= |height= {{convert|167|cm|ft|abbr=on}} |partner= |formerpartner= [[Melissa Militano]] |coach= |formercoach= |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= |skating club= [[SC of New York]] |retired= |medaltemplates= <!-- see [[Template:MedalRelatedTemplates]] --> {{MedalCountry| [[United States]]}} {{MedalSport | Pairs' [[Figure skating]]}} {{MedalCompetition|[[North American Figure Skating Championships|North American Championships]]}} {{MedalSilver| [[1971 North American Figure Skating Championships|1971 Peterborough]]|Pairs}} }} '''Mark William Militano''' (born March 28, 1954 in [[Rockville Centre, New York]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[pair skater]]. With sister [[Melissa Militano]], he is the 1973 [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. national champion]]. They represented the [[United States at the 1972 Winter Olympics]] where [[figure skating at the 1972 Winter Olympics|they placed 7th]].
Militano began skating seriously by the age of 7. Two years later, he formed a pair with his sister Melissa. They lived on [[Long Island]] and were trained by [[Peter Dunfield]] at Sky Rink in [[New York City]].<ref name="twoinone">"The Two-In-One Pair", ''Skating'' magazine, Mar 1971</ref>
Militano had an early interest in composing music, and he and his sister skated to one of his compositions when they were still in their teens.<ref name="twoinone"/> Later in life, Militano wrote music that was used by [[Nancy Kerrigan]] for her short programs at both the [[1992 Winter Olympics|1992]] and [[1994 Winter Olympics]].<ref>[[Nancy Kerrigan]], ''Artistry on Ice'', ISBN 0736036970</ref>
As of 2010, Militano and his wife, former competitor [[Jana Sjodin]], run a coaching, music, and choreography business in the [[Minneapolis]] area, Milimar Inc.
